fr:mainmatter.fr:p: When Bonaparte surveyed his men, a-run from Waterloo
I wonder if he laughed and thought, "I guess that's what I'm due"
and struck the colours from his cap, the medals from his chest
long rusted by his late decline and then his Elban rest
For Waterloo was not the end of Boney's fated run
nor Stalingrad for Hitler, nor for tsardom World War One
The grandpa in the hospital, compressions on his chest
no different from some boys who persevered to pass their test
The first, persisting broken-ribbed, more cruelly fades away
the others' best times spent before their graduation day
No, Waterloo was just Napoleon's needless epilogue
His grand return was celebrated under Fortune's fog
His end came long before; exactly when, nobody'd know
but destiny leaves signs to tell you when it's time to go
If fate announced which musketeer each bullet would go through
perhaps they'd know, for them it was Already Waterloo
